Articles.Content:
• KSP Version: 0.1.1.0.21572
  • Operating System and version  (Windows 10, Windows 11): Windows 10
  • CPU and GPU models, any other system information which could be relevant
  • Description of the bug.  
    • Expected Behavior: Click the wrench button on the wing part to activate procedural wing creation.  A panel should open on top of other panels to allow for procedural wing Creation.
    • Observed Behavior: Clicking the wrench button on the wing part does not display the procedural wing panel. The procedural wing panel opens behind all other windows. Making it seem as if there is a bug. (prior to recording a video for this post I did not know it was behind the parts window)
  • Steps to Replicate: Open VAB. Attach any wing/control surface/stabalizer that allows for procedural modification. Click the wrench icon on the part to begin procedural modifications.
  • Fixes / Workarounds (if known..): Close or move all panels opened to find the procedural wings panel.
  • A list of ALL mods.  If the list is long, please consider using a spoiler window.: None. Vanilla.
  • Other Notes / Screenshots / Log Files (if possible..): While this is not strictly a major bug it will seem like a major bug to anyone not specifically trying to thoroughly test for a bug report.

Windows in VAB are not optimized at all. It only makes sense that if you click a window, it should become the focus and appear on top of the others. But they seem to have a static priority assigned to them.
